reel.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to be confused or shocked by a situation
reel.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Normanâ€™s brain was reeling, but he did his best to appear calm.
The party is still reeling from its recent election defeat.
reel.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to step backwards suddenly and almost fall over, especially after being hit or getting a shock
reel.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The force of the punch sent him reeling against the wall.
reel.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to walk in an unsteady way and almost fall over, as if you are drunk
reel.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Andy reeled away from the bar and knocked over his stool.
reel.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to seem to go around and around
reel.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The room reeled before my eyes and I fainted.
reel.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a round object onto which film, wire, a special string for fishing etc can be wound
reel.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: the amount that one of these objects will hold
reel.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: one of the parts of a cinema film that is contained on a reel
reel.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: a quick folk dance, especially one from Scotland or Ireland, or the music for this
